subject: Data
title: Tally Marks: Humanity's First Data
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Tally Marks: Humanity's First Data.

hook.text: A 20,000-year-old bone found in Congo has scratches that aren't random â€” they're data.

buildup.text: The Ishango bone has grouped notches that may represent lunar cycles or math sequences.

discovery.text: Before writing existed, humans carved marks into bone and stone to track quantities.

twist.text: These tally systems were so effective that shepherds used them well into the 1800s.

climax.text: Every spreadsheet and database traces back to someone scratching a mark on a bone.

punchline.text: Data is older than writing itself.

quiz.question: What is the Ishango bone believed to represent?
options: An early tally or counting system
